attributes.action: Increase funding to allow support for BPD patients to be more accessible.
attributes.additional_details: BPD is one of the most underfunded and misunderstood mental health disorders, even though a large population of people (2%) are estimated to suffer with BPD. This means that 2% of our population is not receiving the quality of care they deserve. As well as this, due to the lack of public awareness, those with BPD suffer a huge amount of stigmatisation from both society and healthcare professionals alike. I believe if we invest in BPD services, we can improve quality of life for those with BPD
attributes.background: The government needs to invest in services for those with BPD to make them more accessible through funding. Every trust should have a dedicated NHS team that has the training and skills to be able to support those who suffer with BPD. Until then we are failing a large mass of people every day.

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition which calls for a similar action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/580853
